title: Has anyone on this thread ever actually lived next door to a commercial logging operation doing 'sel
content: Has anyone on this thread ever actually lived next door to a commercial logging operation doing 'selective thinning' in Montana? They take the big trees, leave choked stands and piles of fuel, and devastate the watershed. Any way you slice it, it only increases fire danger.

title: If you’ve ever lived next door to a commercial logging operation in Montana you would know for absol
content: If you’ve ever lived next door to a commercial logging operation in Montana you would know for absolute certain that what, for example, Plum Creek did caused even more dangerous conditions: choked stands, waste piles, watershed devastation that lead to MORE fire danger.
